pitrou commented on a change in pull request #1977: ARROW-2531: [C++] Update clang bits to 6.0
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1977#discussion_r185270274
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/FindClangTools.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -77,6 +77,18 @@ if (CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION)
                     NO_DEFAULT_PATH
             )
         endif()
+
+        if ("${CLANG_FORMAT_BIN}" STREQUAL "CLANG_FORMAT_BIN-NOTFOUND")
+          # binary was still not found, look into Cellar
+          # TODO: This currently only works for '.0' patch releases as
+          #       find_program does not support regular expressions
+          #       in the paths.
+          find_program(CLANG_FORMAT_BIN
+            NAMES clang-format
+            PATHS /usr/local/Cellar/llvm/${CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION}.0/bin
 
 Review comment:
   What is "Cellar"? Is there a reason we want to hardcode this?

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

xhochy commented on a change in pull request #1977: ARROW-2531: [C++] Update clang bits to 6.0
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1977#discussion_r185270765
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/FindClangTools.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -77,6 +77,18 @@ if (CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION)
                     NO_DEFAULT_PATH
             )
         endif()
+
+        if ("${CLANG_FORMAT_BIN}" STREQUAL "CLANG_FORMAT_BIN-NOTFOUND")
+          # binary was still not found, look into Cellar
+          # TODO: This currently only works for '.0' patch releases as
+          #       find_program does not support regular expressions
+          #       in the paths.
+          find_program(CLANG_FORMAT_BIN
+            NAMES clang-format
+            PATHS /usr/local/Cellar/llvm/${CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION}.0/bin
 
 Review comment:
   This is the location where homebrew stores its unpacked bottles. This is a fixed term. The only location that we might want to make configurable is the use of `/usr/local/` here which is default for homebrew but not always the case.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

robertnishihara commented on issue #1977: ARROW-2531: [C++] Update clang bits to 6.0
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1977#issuecomment-385771024
 
 
   A bit off topic, but one thing that would be really helpful is to show the linting errors in Travis when clang-format fails.
   
   When I want to do linting for Arrow, I often have to build clang-format from source and `make format` never works out of the box for me for whatever reason, so being able to just look at the Travis build would be useful.

----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org

xhochy closed pull request #1977: ARROW-2531: [C++] Update clang bits to 6.0

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

diff --git a/.travis.yml b/.travis.yml
index 015984c7f..736f4fe04 100644
--- a/.travis.yml
+++ b/.travis.yml
@@ -41,7 +41,7 @@ matrix:
   allow_failures:
   - jdk: oraclejdk9
   include:
-  # C++ & Python w/ clang 5.0
+  # C++ & Python w/ clang 6.0
   - compiler: gcc
     language: cpp
     os: linux
@@ -55,8 +55,8 @@ matrix:
     - ARROW_TRAVIS_PYTHON_BENCHMARKS=1
     - ARROW_TRAVIS_PYTHON_DOCS=1
     - ARROW_BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL=CHECKIN
-    - CC="clang-5.0"
-    - CXX="clang++-5.0"
+    - CC="clang-6.0"
+    - CXX="clang++-6.0"
     before_script:
     # Always run RAT checks, in case another build in matrix breaks RAT
     - $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/travis_release_audit.sh
@@ -127,8 +127,8 @@ matrix:
     env: ARROW_TEST_GROUP=integration
     jdk: openjdk8
     env:
-    - CC="clang-5.0"
-    - CXX="clang++-5.0"
+    - CC="clang-6.0"
+    - CXX="clang++-6.0"
     before_script:
     - if [ $ARROW_CI_INTEGRATION_AFFECTED != "1" ]; then exit; fi
     - $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/travis_install_linux.sh
diff --git a/ci/travis_install_clang_tools.sh b/ci/travis_install_clang_tools.sh
index 9c89253df..49b2e4776 100755
--- a/ci/travis_install_clang_tools.sh
+++ b/ci/travis_install_clang_tools.sh
@@ -19,6 +19,6 @@
 
 wget -O - http://llvm.org/apt/llvm-snapshot.gpg.key|sudo apt-key add -
 sudo apt-add-repository -y \
-     "deb http://llvm.org/apt/trusty/ llvm-toolchain-trusty-5.0 main"
+     "deb http://llvm.org/apt/trusty/ llvm-toolchain-trusty-6.0 main"
 sudo apt-get update -qq
-sudo apt-get install -q clang-5.0 clang-format-5.0 clang-tidy-5.0
+sudo apt-get install -q clang-6.0 clang-format-6.0 clang-tidy-6.0
diff --git a/cpp/CMakeLists.txt b/cpp/CMakeLists.txt
index be940eaf4..52a843a7d 100644
--- a/cpp/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/cpp/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -48,7 +48,7 @@ set(ARROW_ABI_VERSION "${ARROW_SO_VERSION}.0.0")
 
 set(BUILD_SUPPORT_DIR "${CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR}/build-support")
 
-set(CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION "5.0")
+set(CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION "6.0")
 find_package(ClangTools)
 if ("$ENV{CMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS}" STREQUAL "1" OR CLANG_TIDY_FOUND)
   # Generate a Clang compile_commands.json "compilation database" file for use
diff --git a/cpp/README.md b/cpp/README.md
index 11c181a51..3091588f1 100644
--- a/cpp/README.md
+++ b/cpp/README.md
@@ -320,10 +320,10 @@ You can also fix any formatting errors automatically:
 
     make format
 
-These commands require `clang-format-5.0` (and not any other version).
+These commands require `clang-format-6.0` (and not any other version).
 You may find the required packages at http://releases.llvm.org/download.html
 or use the Debian/Ubuntu APT repositories on https://apt.llvm.org/. On macOS
-with [Homebrew][1] you can get it via `brew install llvm@5`.
+with [Homebrew][1] you can get it via `brew install llvm@6`.
 
 ## Checking for ABI and API stability
 
diff --git a/cpp/cmake_modules/FindClangTools.cmake b/cpp/cmake_modules/FindClangTools.cmake
index e9221ff22..7d1d2d19e 100644
--- a/cpp/cmake_modules/FindClangTools.cmake
+++ b/cpp/cmake_modules/FindClangTools.cmake
@@ -30,6 +30,12 @@
 #  CLANG_FORMAT_BIN, The path to the clang format binary
 #  CLANG_TIDY_FOUND, Whether clang format was found
 
+if (DEFINED ENV{HOMEBREW_PREFIX})
+  set(HOMEBREW_PREFIX "${ENV{HOMEBREW_PREFIX}")
+else()
+  set(HOMEBREW_PREFIX "/usr/local")
+endif()
+
 find_program(CLANG_TIDY_BIN
   NAMES clang-tidy-4.0
   clang-tidy-3.9
@@ -37,7 +43,7 @@ find_program(CLANG_TIDY_BIN
   clang-tidy-3.7
   clang-tidy-3.6
   clang-tidy
-  PATHS ${ClangTools_PATH} $ENV{CLANG_TOOLS_PATH} /usr/local/bin /usr/bin
+  PATHS ${ClangTools_PATH} $ENV{CLANG_TOOLS_PATH} /usr/local/bin /usr/bin "${HOMEBREW_PREFIX}/bin"
         NO_DEFAULT_PATH
 )
 
@@ -55,7 +61,7 @@ if (CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION)
       PATHS
             ${ClangTools_PATH}
             $ENV{CLANG_TOOLS_PATH}
-            /usr/local/bin /usr/bin
+            /usr/local/bin /usr/bin "${HOMEBREW_PREFIX}/bin"
             NO_DEFAULT_PATH
     )
 
@@ -67,16 +73,28 @@ if (CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION)
         if ("${CLANG_FORMAT_MINOR_VERSION}" STREQUAL "0")
             find_program(CLANG_FORMAT_BIN
               NAMES clang-format
-              PATHS /usr/local/opt/llvm@${CLANG_FORMAT_MAJOR_VERSION}/bin
+              PATHS "${HOMEBREW_PREFIX}/opt/llvm@${CLANG_FORMAT_MAJOR_VERSION}/bin"
                     NO_DEFAULT_PATH
             )
         else()
             find_program(CLANG_FORMAT_BIN
               NAMES clang-format
-              PATHS /usr/local/opt/llvm@${CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION}/bin
+              PATHS "${HOMEBREW_PREFIX}/opt/llvm@${CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION}/bin"
                     NO_DEFAULT_PATH
             )
         endif()
+
+        if ("${CLANG_FORMAT_BIN}" STREQUAL "CLANG_FORMAT_BIN-NOTFOUND")
+          # binary was still not found, look into Cellar
+          # TODO: This currently only works for '.0' patch releases as
+          #       find_program does not support regular expressions
+          #       in the paths.
+          find_program(CLANG_FORMAT_BIN
+            NAMES clang-format
+            PATHS "${HOMEBREW_PREFIX}/Cellar/llvm/${CLANG_FORMAT_VERSION}.0/bin"
+                  NO_DEFAULT_PATH
+          )
+        endif()
     endif()
 else()
     find_program(CLANG_FORMAT_BIN
@@ -86,7 +104,7 @@ else()
       clang-format-3.7
       clang-format-3.6
       clang-format
-      PATHS ${ClangTools_PATH} $ENV{CLANG_TOOLS_PATH} /usr/local/bin /usr/bin
+      PATHS ${ClangTools_PATH} $ENV{CLANG_TOOLS_PATH} /usr/local/bin /usr/bin "${HOMEBREW_PREFIX}/bin"
             NO_DEFAULT_PATH
     )
 endif()
diff --git a/cpp/src/arrow/builder.cc b/cpp/src/arrow/builder.cc
index ece191f3e..71af87ae1 100644
--- a/cpp/src/arrow/builder.cc
+++ b/cpp/src/arrow/builder.cc
@@ -1626,8 +1626,8 @@ Status StructBuilder::FinishInternal(std::shared_ptr<ArrayData>* out) {
   return Status::OK();
 }
 
-  // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
-  // Helper functions
+// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
+// Helper functions
 
 #define BUILDER_CASE(ENUM, BuilderType)      \
   case Type::ENUM:                           \
diff --git a/cpp/src/arrow/io/io-buffered-test.cc b/cpp/src/arrow/io/io-buffered-test.cc
index 829a2d52f..0fa5ca184 100644
--- a/cpp/src/arrow/io/io-buffered-test.cc
+++ b/cpp/src/arrow/io/io-buffered-test.cc
@@ -72,7 +72,7 @@ class TestBufferedOutputStream : public FileTestFixture {
     ASSERT_OK(FileOutputStream::Open(path_, append, &file));
     fd_ = file->file_descriptor();
     if (append) {
-    // Workaround for ARROW-2466 ("append" flag doesn't set file pos)
+      // Workaround for ARROW-2466 ("append" flag doesn't set file pos)
 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
       _lseeki64(fd_, 0, SEEK_END);
 #else
diff --git a/cpp/src/arrow/python/numpy_convert.cc b/cpp/src/arrow/python/numpy_convert.cc
index 0cd616aec..e91aae1e5 100644
--- a/cpp/src/arrow/python/numpy_convert.cc
+++ b/cpp/src/arrow/python/numpy_convert.cc
@@ -46,8 +46,8 @@ bool is_contiguous(PyObject* array) {
 }
 
 int cast_npy_type_compat(int type_num) {
-// Both LONGLONG and INT64 can be observed in the wild, which is buggy. We set
-// U/LONGLONG to U/INT64 so things work properly.
+  // Both LONGLONG and INT64 can be observed in the wild, which is buggy. We set
+  // U/LONGLONG to U/INT64 so things work properly.
 
 #if (NPY_INT64 == NPY_LONGLONG) && (NPY_SIZEOF_LONGLONG == 8)
   if (type_num == NPY_LONGLONG) {
diff --git a/cpp/src/arrow/type.cc b/cpp/src/arrow/type.cc
index 2eb996797..16e758525 100644
--- a/cpp/src/arrow/type.cc
+++ b/cpp/src/arrow/type.cc
@@ -367,8 +367,8 @@ std::shared_ptr<Schema> schema(std::vector<std::shared_ptr<Field>>&& fields,
   return std::make_shared<Schema>(std::move(fields), metadata);
 }
 
-  // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
-  // Visitors and factory functions
+// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
+// Visitors and factory functions
 
 #define ACCEPT_VISITOR(TYPE) \
   Status TYPE::Accept(TypeVisitor* visitor) const { return visitor->Visit(*this); }
